decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Guide of Souls, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Support cards such as Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah help maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Elegant Parlor and Ranger-Captain of Eos for control and card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells. The key strategy is to use cards like Expedition Map to find and assemble the UrzaTron lands quickly, allowing for early plays of high-impact creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths. The deck also includes control elements like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator, as well as disruption tools like All Is Dust and Chalice of the Void to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies.

The deck focuses on filling up the graveyard with creatures and then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. It includes cards like Street Wraith, Curator of Mysteries, and Endurance to help cycle through the deck quickly and put creatures into the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Ardent Plea and Shardless Agent to cascade into Living End. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a board full of creatures after casting Living End, potentially winning the game in one big combo turn.

This Ruby Storm deck focuses on casting spells quickly and efficiently to generate lots of mana and create a storm of spells to overwhelm the opponent. It features cards like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Desperate Ritual to accelerate mana production, along with Wrenn's Resolve and Ral, Monsoon Mage to draw cards and maintain momentum. The deck also includes Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard, allowing for big combo turns with cards like Grapeshot and Glimpse the Impossible. The goal is to cast multiple spells in a single turn to finish the game in explosive fashion.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, supported by Leyline synergies and counter magic. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence with efficient creatures like Ragavan and Scion of Draco, while using Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding to control the opponent's board. Consign to Memory provides card advantage and disruption, while Stubborn Denial offers protection against opposing spells. The mana base is optimized for consistent color access, allowing for fast and powerful plays. Overall, the deck focuses on fast, proactive plays to pressure the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on using a variety of creatures with abilities that can be tutored for and assembled to create powerful combos. The toolbox aspect allows the player to search for specific creatures as needed to fit the situation. The deck includes cards that facilitate sacrificing creatures for value and recursion, allowing for flexibility and resilience in generating advantage. By carefully selecting and utilizing the creatures in the deck, the player can create a versatile and adaptable strategy to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of instant-speed cards and disruptive spells to control the game while ramping up to powerful combo finishers. By cleverly timing counterspells and disruptive effects, the deck aims to set up a game-winning scenario with cards like Thundertrap Trainer, Hydroelectric Specimen, and Goblin Charbelcher. The deck's win condition relies heavily on assembling the right pieces at the right time to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory without needing to rely on traditional land-based strategies.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game through card advantage and powerful spells, using cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also focuses on board control with cards like Solitude and Supreme Verdict, while also utilizing countermagic with Counterspell and Force of Negation. Additionally, the deck includes various land cards and card draw spells to ensure consistency and resilience in longer games. The deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the game until it can assemble a winning board state.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to ramp up mana quickly, allowing for explosive plays with cards like Scapeshift and Gruul Turf. The key strategy involves utilizing Urza's Saga to find key combo pieces like Vesuva and Lotus Field, while also using Summoner's Pact to search for Primeval Titan. The goal is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to generate a large amount of mana and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Primeval Titan.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending. It also utilizes instant spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude for removal, while maintaining control with counter spells like Force of Negation. By cycling through the deck and taking advantage of graveyard interaction, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful combos and reanimated threats early in the game.

This deck focuses on using low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and maintain board control. It utilizes cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure early in the game, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart provide direct damage to the opponent or creatures. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to ensure consistency. The overall strategy revolves around efficiently using resources to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful combo using cards like Lotus Bloom and Goblin Charbelcher, while disrupting your opponent with counter spells like Disrupting Shoal and Stern Scolding. The deck also includes control elements like Sea Gate Restoration and Jwari Disruption to protect your combos. The goal is to win the game without relying on traditional land cards, making it a unique and challenging strategy in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Indomitable Creativity and Leyline Binding to quickly assemble powerful combos and control the board. By using cards like Archon of Cruelty and Wrenn and Six to disrupt your opponent's strategy, while also generating value from lands like Dwarven Mine and Xander's Lounge, you aim to create overwhelming board states and win the game in a creative and unexpected manner. Prismatic Ending and Lightning Bolt provide additional removal and disruption to help you secure victory.

The main concept of this Modern Mono Black Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while efficiently removing threats with Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command. The deck also aims to apply pressure with aggressive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Emperor of Bones, and Nethergoyf. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Shadowspear and Graveyard Trespasser to provide additional utility and versatility. The mana base is streamlined with lands like Eldrazi Temple and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth, along with the powerful Urza's Saga to help generate additional value.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms for control and disruption, along with versatile spells like Kozilek's Command and Dismember. The deck aims to control the game through powerful creatures and disruptive spells, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with its strong board presence and control elements.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny provide additional disruption while applying pressure. The deck also includes various removal spells and artifacts to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around ramping up mana, controlling the game, and deploying impactful threats to dominate the battlefield.
